com.vmware.vapi.protocol

Class HttpConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vmware.vapi.protocol.HttpConfiguration

  • public final class HttpConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used for configuring the HTTP client that is used by the runtime client. The class is immutable.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  HttpConfiguration.BasicHeader
      A basic implementation of HttpConfiguration.Header.
      static class  HttpConfiguration.Builder
      Builder class for the HttpConfiguration.
      static interface  HttpConfiguration.Header
      Represents an HTTP header field.
      static interface  HttpConfiguration.HeadersProvider
      Callback for supplying HTTP headers per request.
      static class  HttpConfiguration.KeyStoreConfig
      This class contains the client certificates configuration.
      static class  HttpConfiguration.LibType
      Type of the third-party HTTP library which would be used by the transport implementation.
      static class  HttpConfiguration.SslConfiguration
      This class contains the SSL configuration.

        public int getConnectTimeout()
        Returns:
        the amount of time in milliseconds the client is going to wait for establishing the connection

      • getSoTimeout

        public int getSoTimeout()
        Returns:
        the amount of time in milliseconds the client is going to wait for a response before timing out

      • getMaxConnections

        public int getMaxConnections()
        Returns:
        the maximum number of outstanding TCP connections

      • getKeepAlivePeriod

        public long getKeepAlivePeriod()
        Maximum keep alive period for pooled/idle TCP connections. This value MUST be lower than max idle time in the server.
        Returns:
        the maximum keep alive period for pooled/idle TCP connections

      • getHeadersProvider

        public HttpConfiguration.HeadersProvider getHeadersProvider()
        Returns:
        the callback instance for adding headers to all requests; may be null
